result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan A. Potack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ryan Anthony Potack in court with attorney Arne Richard Skatrud.  Defendant Ryan Anthony Potack in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14 CF 179 and 14 CF 44.  State argues sentencing - counts 2,3,4 and 5 in 14 CF 44 - 1 year jail - any unpaid court obligations to be converted to civil judgment and 14 CF 179 count 2 - 90 days consecutive to 14 CF 44 - any unpaid court obligations converted to civil judgment.  Atty Skatrud argues sentencing.  DE addressed the Court


COURT:  
14 CF 179:  90 days county jail with good time and huber consecutive to 14 CF 44 -  any unpaid court obligations to be converted to civil judgment

DEF Ryan Potack appears in court with Atty Michael Hoffman.   ADA John Yackel appears for the state of WI.  Reset initial appearance- tracking with 14CF44.  Adjourned Initial appearance 9-23-14 @ 2:30.

Ryan Potack appears in custody, by video.  ADA John Yackel appears for the State of WI.  Court finds probable cause and orders $1500 signature bond with condition of no contact w/Tiffany Hamilton. DEF states he will be staying with his sister, Brittany Butler.  DEF did not know her address, so court orders providing the correct address as a condition and failure to provide the address will be violation of his bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for 8-05-14 @ 11:00am.
